Package pieces

Class Piece

java.lang.Object
pieces.Piece
Direct Known Subclasses:
Bishop, King, Knight, Pawn, Queen, Rook
public abstract class Piece extends Object
This abstract class is responsible for outlining general Piece functionality. Subclasses of Piece are: King, Queen, Bishop, Knight, Pawn, and Rook.
Author:
Julius Ramirez

  • Constructor Details

    • Piece

      public Piece(boolean white)
      Creates a new piece, only saving its color. The location of the piece must thus be set after its creation. Selected is initialized to false.
      Parameters:
      white - true if the piece is white, false if it is not.

  • Method Details

    • toString

      public String toString()
      This method returns a string in the form of: "COLOR PIECE (X,Y)"
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      a string describing the state of the piece.

    • validMove

      public boolean validMove(int x, int y, Tile[][] tiles)
      This method returns a boolean indicating if the move is valid. A move is valid if it is a standard move of that piece, and if it the movement does not collide with pieces already on the board. It assumes that the new coordinate is different than the current pieces coordinate.
      Parameters:
      x - any integer between 0-7 inclusive.
      y - any integer between 0-7 inclusive.
      tiles - a 2D array containing Tile objects that contain a Piece field.
      Returns:
      a boolean, true if move can be made, false if not.

    • draw

      public void draw(org.eclipse.swt.graphics.GC gc)
      This method is responsible for drawing a piece onto the UI canvas.
      Parameters:
      gc - the graphical context where the image is to be drawn onto.

    • hasEnemyPiece

      public boolean hasEnemyPiece(int x, int y, Tile[][] tiles)
      This helper method is used in the generateMove() methods, it returns true if the tile has an enemy piece.
      Parameters:
      x - the x, between 0 and 7 inclusive, to be moved to.
      y - the y, between 0 and 7 inclusive, to be moved to.
      tiles - a 2D list containing Tile objects which contain an accessible Piece field.
      Returns:
      true if enemy piece is at x/y, false if it's empty or a friendly piece.

    • hasFriendlyPiece

      public boolean hasFriendlyPiece(int x, int y, Tile[][] tiles)
      This helper method is used in the generateMove() methods, it returns true if the tile has a friendly piece.
      Parameters:
      x - the x, between 0 and 7 inclusive, to be moved to.
      y - the y, between 0 and 7 inclusive, to be moved to.
      tiles - a 2D list containing Tile objects which contain an accessible Piece field.
      Returns:
      true if friendly piece is at x/y, false if it's empty or an enemy piece.

    • getColor

      public String getColor()
      Returns the string color of the piece.
      Returns:
      "White" if white, else "Black"

    • isDead

      public boolean isDead()
      Returns the dead fields current status. The dead field is used by the AI.
      Returns:
      true if piece is dead, false if not.

    • getName

      public String getName()
      Returns the name of the piece, used in opponent promotion determination.
      Returns:
      the string name of the piece in the form: PIECE

    • isWhite

      public boolean isWhite()
      This method is used to determine the color of the piece, returning the piece's white field which is true if the piece is white, false if it is black.
      Returns:
      true if piece is white, false if black.

    • getX

      public int getX()
      This getter method returns the x value of the piece.
      Returns:
      an integer between 0 and 7 inclusive representing the x value of the piece.

    • getY

      public int getY()
      This getter method returns the y value of the piece.
      Returns:
      an integer between 0 and 7 inclusive representing the y value of the piece.

    • isSelected

      public boolean isSelected()
      This method return a boolean indicating if this piece is selected.
      Returns:
      true if this piece is selected, false if not.

    • updateLocation

      public void updateLocation(int x, int y)
      This method updates the location of a the piece.
      Parameters:
      x - any integer between 0-7 inclusive.
      y - any integer between 0-7 inclusive.

    • setLocation

      public void setLocation(int x, int y)
      This method sets the x/y coordinate of the piece. It MUST be given the graphical x/y values where the user has clicked. It is the only method that interprets x/y in this way and could be improved by following the x/y = coordinate convention, which would allow for easier move simulation due to no longer needing to save a piece's booleans.
      Parameters:
      x - the x coordinate where the user clicked
      y - the y coordinate where the user clicked

    • SetNotSelected

      public void SetNotSelected()
      This method sets the piece as not selected so that when drawing the canvas, it does not highlight it anymore.

    • setDeadStatus

      public void setDeadStatus(boolean status)
      Sets the dead field of the piece accordingly which is used by the AI.
      Parameters:
      status - , true if piece is dead, false if not.

    • killPiece

      public void killPiece()
      Sets the dead field to true so that it may not be moved by the AI.

    • setSelected

      public void setSelected()
      This method sets the pieces selected boolean to true so it may be highlighted on the canvas.

    • setWidth

      public static void setWidth(int width)
      This method is used to set the SQUARE_WIDTH variable, a static variable representing how wide each tile on the board is which is necessary for when a piece must draw itself onto the UI.
      Parameters:
      width - , an integer representing how wide a square is on the board.

    • setImage

      public void setImage(org.eclipse.swt.graphics.Image image)
      This method sets the image of the piece so that it is properly represented on the chess board.
      Parameters:
      image - an Image object which is a visual representation of the piece.

    • standardMove

      public abstract boolean standardMove(int x, int y)
      This method returns a boolean depending on if the piece is moved in a way that it is intended to move, both state specific move or as it generally is moved.

      Due to the creation of generateMoves() this method could be entirely scrapped, however special moves such as en passant or castling have their fields updated accordingly during this method call and thus removal requires more structural changes.

      Parameters:
      x - any integer between 0-7 inclusive.
      y - any integer between 0-7 inclusive.
      Returns:
      true if the piece is moved in a legal way, false if not.

    • hasNoCollisions

      public abstract boolean hasNoCollisions(int x, int y, Tile[][] tiles)
      Returns a boolean indicating if the piece collides with a friendly piece at the x/y coordinate. Enemy collisions are allowed.

      Due to the creation of generateMoves() this method could be entirely scrapped, however special moves such as en passant or castling have their fields updated accordingly during this method call and thus removal requires more structural changes.

      Parameters:
      x - any integer between 0-7 inclusive
      y - any integer between 0-7 inclusive
      tiles - a 2D list containing Tile objects which contain an accessible Piece field.
      Returns:
      true if no pieces are in the way, false if a piece would be blocking the move.

    • generateMoves

      public abstract List<Coordinate> generateMoves(Tile[][] tiles)
      This method generates most of the valid moves a piece can do in terms of standard piece movement and no collisions made. It does NOT filter out non-valid check related moves (i.e. moves that keep the king in check/put the king in check).
      Parameters:
      tiles - tiles a 2D list containing Tile objects which contain an accessible Piece field.
      Returns:
      a List of Coordinate objects which are spaces where the piece can possibly move.
